content.question: The tide removes sand from Sandy Point Beach at a rate modeled by the function R, given by <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>R</mi> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> <mo>=</mo> <mn>2</mn> <mo>+</mo> <mn>5</mn> <mi>sin</mi> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mrow> <mfrac> <mrow> <mn>4</mn> <mi>π</mi> <mi>t</mi> </mrow> <mrow> <mn>25</mn> </mrow> </mfrac> </mrow> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@46AC@</annotation> </semantics> </math>. A pumping station adds sand to the beach at a rate modeled by the function S, given by <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>S</mi> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> <mo>=</mo> <mfrac> <mrow> <mn>15</mn> <mi>t</mi> </mrow> <mrow> <mn>1</mn> <mo>+</mo> <mn>3</mn> <mi>t</mi> </mrow> </mfrac> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@40A7@</annotation> </semantics> </math>. Both R(t) and S(t) have units of cubic yards per hour and t is measured in hours for <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mn>0</mn> <mo>≤</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo>≤</mo> <mn>6</mn> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3BF1@</annotation> </semantics> </math>. At time t = 0, the beach contains 2500 cubic yards of sand. (a) How much sand will the tide remove from the beach during this 6-hour period? Indicate units of measure.

frqParts.text: The tide removes sand from Sandy Point Beach at a rate modeled by the function R, given by <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>R</mi> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> <mo>=</mo> <mn>2</mn> <mo>+</mo> <mn>5</mn> <mi>sin</mi> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mrow> <mfrac> <mrow> <mn>4</mn> <mi>π</mi> <mi>t</mi> </mrow> <mrow> <mn>25</mn> </mrow> </mfrac> </mrow> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@46AC@</annotation> </semantics> </math>. A pumping station adds sand to the beach at a rate modeled by the function S, given by <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>S</mi> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> <mo>=</mo> <mfrac> <mrow> <mn>15</mn> <mi>t</mi> </mrow> <mrow> <mn>1</mn> <mo>+</mo> <mn>3</mn> <mi>t</mi> </mrow> </mfrac> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@40A7@</annotation> </semantics> </math>. Both R(t) and S(t) have units of cubic yards per hour and t is measured in hours for <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mn>0</mn> <mo>≤</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo>≤</mo> <mn>6</mn> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3BF1@</annotation> </semantics> </math>. At time t = 0, the beach contains 2500 cubic yards of sand. (a) How much sand will the tide remove from the beach during this 6-hour period? Indicate units of measure.
(b) Write an expression for Y(t), the total number of cubic yards of sand on the beach at time t.
(c) Find the rate at which the total amount of sand on the beach is changing at time t = 4.

(d) For <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mn>0</mn> <mo>≤</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo>≤</mo> <mn>6</mn> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3BF1@</annotation> </semantics> </math>, at what time t is the amount of sand on the beach a minimum? What is the minimum value? Justify your answers.

topic.text: 4.3: Rates of Change in Applied Contexts Other Than Motion

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
